channel.title: Comments on: Oracle Calls It MINUS, PostgreSQL Calls It EXCEPT

item.title: By: Noah Yetter
item.dc:creator: Noah Yetter
item.description: 8 years later MySQL is up to 5.6, and still no MINUS. GG.
item.content:encoded: 8 years later MySQL is up to 5.6, and still no MINUS. GG.

item.title: By: Antonin Faltynek
item.dc:creator: Antonin Faltynek
item.description: In some cases (large result sets) EXCEPT can be much more slower then 'NOT IN' or 'LEFT JOIN'. But as a quick replacement it is same.
item.content:encoded: In some cases (large result sets) EXCEPT can be much more slower then ‘NOT IN’ or ‘LEFT JOIN’. But as a quick replacement it is same.

item.title: By: Scott Clancy
item.dc:creator: Scott Clancy
item.description: Thanks for the info. I tried this but the results were the same as if I had used NOT IN and encountered a NULL - i.e, it acted as though the 'expression' was false
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the info. I tried this but the results were the same as if I had used NOT IN and encountered a NULL – i.e, it acted as though the ‘expression’ was false
